title: New & Video: Oupa – Physical
content:
Not being a huge Yuck fan, I was at first apprehensive to check out Oupa, the side project of lead singer Daniel Blumberg.

However, after overcoming any preconceived opinions, it didn’t take long for me to fall head over heels in love with his melancholic, thoughtful ballads; expressing a more mature, distinct sound to that of noise rock outfit Yuck. First release, the Weakend EP is a stunning collection of heart-wrenching serenades, personal highlight being the exquisitely elegant Walk. With a seven track cassette release around the corner, Oupa have made new song Physical available for streaming, as well as providing a resplendently handsome video to accompany the track.

Documenting what appears to be a night-time drive through a burning forest, with the faint outline of a teenage girl overlay-ed on top of the harrowing images of destruction, providing a startling contrast. Coming in at almost seven minutes, Physical is a courteous composition; restrained and purposefully delicate, relying heavily on the sublime vocals. Check out the video below and pre-order Forget from Boiled Egg.

Oupa – Physical from Boiled Egg on Vimeo.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
